content:
5.74. 
Documents
1. Unless the heirs have agreed otherwise, the documents of the family and of the estate shall not be divided and shall be deposited by common consent with one of the heirs or with the heir who has received the largest share of the estate or, if the shares are equal, with the heir presiding. The heir to whom the documents are deposited shall be obliged to allow the other heirs to have access to the documents and to make copies or extracts thereof.
2. The heir to whom the immovable property passes shall receive the documents of the immovable property. If several heirs inherit the immovable property, the documents shall be kept with one of them by common agreement.
3. Disputes concerning documents shall be settled by the court, taking into account the size of the shares, the use of the immovable property, the place of residence of the heirs and other circumstances.
